clinical_study.official_title: Anatomy of Subcutaneous Structures in Areas With and Without Cellulite Depressions by Magnetic Resonance Imaging
clinical_study.source: Brazilan Center for Studies in Dermatology

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the anatomy of subcutaneous structures in areas with and without cellulite on the buttocks of same subjects with a non invasive technique, Magnetic Resonance Imaging.

detailed_description.textblock: A cross-sectional study was performed at a single center, in accordance with good clinical practice. Thirty women aged 18 to 50 were included in this study. An experienced dermatologist evaluated all of the subjects in a standing position, with relaxed gluteus muscles, using the CSS classification. An area with cellulite and another without cellulite on the contralateral buttock were selected. The area with cellulite had an evident depressed lesion, whereas the area without cellulite had no depressed or raised lesions, The selected cellulite depression was marked with a positive symbol using a skin marking pen.

primary_outcome.measure: The presence and characteristics of the fibrous septa in areas with and without cellulite.

secondary_outcome.measure: The characteristics of the subcutaneous tissue in areas with and without cellulite.

study_pop.textblock: Females patients with cellulite on the buttocks.
